articles.title: Kalshi bets on Neal Katyal in prediction market cases
articles.summary: Kalshi has hired former U.S. Solicitor General Neal Katyal to represent them in their ongoing legal battles over which prediction markets they can operate. This signals Kalshi is preparing for major Supreme Court-level fights that could determine whether prediction markets become mainstream or remain heavily restricted.

articles.title: "Survivor 50" hasn't aired yet, but Kalshi, Polymarket have picked a winner
articles.summary: Prediction markets on Kalshi and Polymarket are already pricing favorites for Survivor's milestone 50th season before it hits the airwaves. This marks another expansion of entertainment betting beyond traditional sports, showing how prediction markets are becoming the go-to platform for literally any outcome people want to speculate on.

articles.title: Prediction Markets May Have Inadvertently Outed Themselves as Casinos
articles.summary: Prediction markets appear to have revealed their true nature as gambling platforms rather than information aggregation tools through some recent behavior or regulatory treatment. This threatens their credibility with institutional users and could trigger stricter gambling regulations that would cripple their growth in the US market.

articles.title: Gov. Cox took aim at sports betting apps. Kalshi is fighting back — in court.
articles.summary: Kalshi is asking a federal judge to block Utah officials from interfering with prediction markets, apparently after the state tried to shut down betting activity within its borders. If successful, this could set a precedent that shields prediction markets from state-level crackdowns and clarifies whether federal oversight trumps local gambling laws.

articles.title: This Looks Like an Insider Bet on Aliens
articles.summary: Someone with inside knowledge appears to be placing unusually large or confident bets on alien disclosure or UFO-related events. This signals either genuine leaked information worth following or a sophisticated pump scheme that could create profitable counter-betting opportunities for sharp prediction market traders.

articles.title: US regulator says it has power to police prediction market misconduct
articles.summary: The CFTC is flexing its regulatory muscles, claiming it already has authority to crack down on manipulation and fraud in prediction markets. This signals that platforms and traders can expect enforcement actions without waiting for new legislation, which means the Wild West days of unpoliced prediction betting are ending fast.

articles.title: MrBeast video editor fined over insider trading
articles.summary: A video editor who works for MrBeast got slapped with fines for insider trading, presumably using non-public information about upcoming content or business deals to make profitable trades. This shows how prediction markets around YouTube creators and content drops are getting sophisticated enough that regulators now treat leaked information as seriously as traditional securities fraud.

articles.title: An accountant won a big jackpot on Kalshi by betting against DOGE
articles.summary: An accountant scored a massive payout on Kalshi by betting that Dogecoin would tank, proving that financial fundamentals still beat meme coin mania. The win shows prediction markets are attracting serious money from people who actually understand balance sheets, not just crypto Twitter hype.

articles.title: Will 'Sinners' win at Oscars? When will Maduro fall? Place your bets.
articles.summary: Prediction markets are taking action on whether Colman Domingo's film "Sing Sing" will snag Oscar gold and when Venezuelan strongman Nicolás Maduro's regime will finally collapse. Both markets reveal how bettors are pricing long-shot cultural moments against geopolitical powder kegs, creating wildly different risk profiles for the same speculative dollar.

articles.title: Everyone Is Betting on Polymarket, but Smart Investors Are Betting on This AI Stock Instead
articles.summary: Polymarket's getting all the attention, but savvy money is quietly piling into an AI stock that's probably powering the prediction market boom behind the scenes. Smart investors know that when everyone's betting on the casino, you should own the company selling the chips.

articles.title: Everything can be a bet now – the rise and risks of prediction markets
articles.summary: Prediction markets are expanding beyond politics and sports into virtually every aspect of life, from celebrity breakups to corporate earnings to weather patterns. This explosion of betting opportunities creates new profit potential for sharp bettors while raising serious questions about whether turning everything into a wager actually improves decision-making or just feeds gambling addiction.

articles.title: Will Donald Trump's tie be blue?
articles.summary: Someone's running a prediction market on the color of Donald Trump's necktie at his next major public appearance. It's the kind of oddball prop bet that attracts casual money and creates easy arbitrage opportunities for sharp bettors who track Trump's wardrobe patterns.
